channel.title: History on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in History on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Photos of Japan that haven't changed in 150 years
item.description: I was pointed to an article on Cosmographia which in turn shared an archive of photos taken in 19th century Japan. These are amazing photos, but what struck me was how familiar some of them felt. Photos taken from 150 years ago should feel like looking into another world, but some of these scenes, the architecture, are still very present today. It makes it clear how cultural artifacts are so remarkably well-preserved here.

item.title: Web links - July 2022
item.description:
Magic mirror': Hidden image revealed in reflection of centuries-old artifact at Cincinnati Art Museum (edition.cnn.com)
A seemingly blank bronze mirror reflects an image of Buddha when shining a bright light onto it. Aside from how amazing it is that this was discovered, the craftsmanship is incredible.
Compare Webb's Images to Hubble's (johnedchristensen.github.io)
Yes the images from the Webb telescope are beautiful, but direct comparisons like this really put it into perspective. And this shows the galaxy cluster as it was 4.6 billion years ago? I don't even know what to think about that.
Mendon, Missouri - Sean of the South (seandietrich.com)
A short telling of how residents of a small town came together to help the victims of a rail road accident.

item.title: Web links - June 2022
item.description:
Compound pejoratives on Reddit – from buttface to wankpuffin (colinmorris.github.io)
A thorough analysis of the distribution of derogatory terms used on Reddit. Fascinating and hilarious.
My Out-of-Body Experience - Nautilus (nautil.us)
Reflections on the author's experience in a sensory deprivation tank.
prompt.press - AI generated artwork inspired by current events (prompt.press)
The author mentioned that these are heavily curated, but nonetheless they are extremely compelling.
Grumpy Gamer - Return to Monkey Island Trailer (www.grumpygamer.com)
Serendeputy: Newsfeed Engine for the open web (serendeputy.com)
I've been thinking about a product like this for a very long time, so it must be a good idea. Depends heavily on who you follow though, so I would probably end up creating a separate account.
She Spent a Decade Writing Fake Russian History. Wikipedia Just Noticed. (www.sixthtone.com)

item.title: Original iChat UI
item.description: It's always exciting to see original prototypes of good products. Not to mention the sample conversation going on in there is rather delightful.

item.title: Donkey Kong and Me
item.description: An excellent story about the making of Donkey Kong and what it was like to work in an early video game company.

item.title: Iterations of Google's logo
item.description: I'm definitely glad they keep iterating until they got to the current version, but that 2nd revision’s pretty neat too.
